Activation keys

Activation keys / index

GET /katello/api/activation_keys
List activation keys

GET /katello/api/environments/:environment_id/activation_keys

GET /katello/api/organizations/:organization_id/activation_keys

Params

  • organization_id : Required [

    number.

    ]

    organization identifier

  • environment_id : Optional [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    environment identifier

  • content_view_id : Optional [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    content view identifier

  • name : Optional [

    String

    ]

    activation key name to filter by

  • search : Optional [

    String

    ]

    Search string

  • page : Optional [

    number.

    ]

    Page number, starting at 1

  • per_page : Optional [

    number.

    ]

    Number of results per page to return

  • order : Optional [

    String

    ]

    Sort field and order, eg. ‘name DESC’

  • full_results : Optional [

    boolean

    ]

    Whether or not to show all results

  • sort : Optional [

    Hash

    ]

    Hash version of ‘order’ param

    • by : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Field to sort the results on

    • order : Optional [

      String

      ]

      How to order the sorted results (e.g. ASC for ascending)

Activation keys / create

POST /katello/api/activation_keys
Create an activation key

Params

  • organization_id : Required [

    number.

    ]

    organization identifier

  • name : Required [

    String

    ]

    name

  • description : Optional [

    String

    ]

    description

  • environment : Optional [

    Hash

    ]

    environment

  • environment_id : Optional [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    id. d’entorn

  • content_view_id : Optional [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    content view id

  • max_content_hosts : Optional [

    number.

    ]

    maximum number of registered content hosts

  • unlimited_content_hosts : Optional [

    boolean

    ]

    can the activation key have unlimited content hosts

Activation keys / add_subscriptions

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    ID of the activation key

  • subscription_id : Optional [

    number.

    ]

  • quantity : Optional [

    number.

    ]

    Quantity of this subscription to add

  • subscriptions : Optional [

    Must be an Array of nested elements

    ]

    Array of subscriptions to add

    • id : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Subscription Pool uuid

    • quantity : Optional [

      number.

      ]

      Quantity of this subscriptions to add

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    ID of the activation key

  • content_override : Optional [

    Hash

    ]

    Content override parameters

    • content_label : Required [

      String

      ]

      Label of the content

    • value : Required [

      Must be one of: 0, 1, default.

      ]

      Override to 0/1, or ‘default’

Content reports

Content reports / system_status

GET /katello/api/content_reports/system_status
Show the latest subscription status for a list of content hosts that have reported their subscription status during a specified time period. Running this report with minimal parameters will return all status records for all reported content hosts.

Params

  • system_id : Optional [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    Filters the results by the given content host UUID.

  • organization_id : Required [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    Organization ID

  • status : Optional [

    Must be one of: valid, invalid, partial.

    ]

    Filter results on content host status.

  • on_date : Optional [

    Must be a Date in the form of YYYY-MM-DD.

    ]

    Date to filter on. If not given, defaults to NOW. Results will be limited to status records that were last reported before or on the given date. Must be a date in the form of “YYYY-MM-DD” or “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”.

  • management_enabled : Optional [

    boolean

    ]

    Include only content-hosts with the management enabled attribute true or false

Content reports / system_trend

GET /katello/api/content_reports/system_trend
Show a listing of all subscription status snapshots from content hosts which have reported their subscription status in the specified time period.

Params

  • system_id : Required [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    Filters the results by the given content host UUID.

  • organization_id : Required [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    Organization ID

  • start_date : Optional [

    Must be a Date in the form of YYYY-MM-DD.

    ]

    Start date. Used in conjunction with end_date. Must be a date in the form of “YYYY-MM-DD” or “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”.

  • end_date : Optional [

    Must be a Date in the form of YYYY-MM-DD.

    ]

    End date. Used in conjunction with start_date. Must be a date in the form of “YYYY-MM-DD” or “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”.

  • hours : Optional [

    Integer

    ]

    Show a trend between HOURS and now. Used independently of start_date/end_date.

Content view versions / incremental_update

POST /katello/api/content_view_versions/incremental_update
Perform an Incremental Update on one or more Content View Versions

Params

  • content_view_version_environments : Optional [

    Must be an Array of nested elements

    ]
    • content_view_version_id : Optional [

      string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

      ]

      Content View Version Ids to perform an incremental update on. May contain composites as well as one or more components to update.

    • environment_ids : Optional [

      Must be an array of any type

      ]

      The list of environments to promote the specified Content View Version to (replacing the older version).

  • description : Optional [

    String

    ]

    The description for the new generated Content View Versions

  • resolve_dependencies : Optional [

    boolean

    ]

    If true, when adding the specified errata or packages, any needed dependencies will be copied as well.

  • propagate_all_composites : Optional [

    boolean

    ]

    If true, will publish a new composite version using any specified content_view_version_id that has been promoted to a lifecycle environment.

  • add_content : Optional [

    Hash

    ]
    • errata_ids : Optional [

      Must be an array of any type

      ]

      Errata uuids to copy into the new versions.

    • package_ids : Optional [

      Must be an array of any type

      ]

      Package uuids to copy into the new versions.

    • puppet_module_ids : Optional [

      Must be an array of any type

      ]

      Puppet Modules to copy into the new versions.

  • update_systems : Optional [

    Hash

    ]

    After generating the incremental update, apply the changes to the specified systems. Only Errata are supported currently.

    • included : Required [

      Hash

      ]
      • search : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

        String

        ]

        Search string for systems to perform an action on

      • ids : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

        Must be an array of any type

        ]

        List of system ids to perform an action on

    • excluded : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Hash

      ]
      • ids : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

        Must be an array of any type

        ]

        List of system ids to exclude and not run an action on

    • update_all_systems : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      Update all editable and applicable systems, not just ones using the selected Content View Versions and Environments

Domains

Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are or the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

Import puppet classes from puppet proxy for an environment

Params

  • id : Required [

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    ]

    String

    ]
  • environment_id : Optional [

    String

    ]
  • dryrun : Optional [

    boolean

    ]
  • except : Optional [

    String

    ]

    Optional comma-delimited string containing either ‘new’, ‘updated’, or ‘obsolete’ that is used to limit the imported Puppet classes

Foreman tasks / bulk_search

POST /foreman_tasks/api/tasks/bulk_search
List dynflow tasks for uuids

For every search it returns the list of tasks that satisfty the condition. The reason for supporting multiple searches is the UI that might be ending needing periodic updates on task status for various searches at the same time. This way, it is possible to get all the task statuses with one request.

Params

  • searches : Optional [

    Must be an Array of nested elements

    ]

    List of uuids to fetch info about

    • search_id : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Arbitraty value for client to identify the the request parts with results. It’s passed in the results to be able to pair the requests and responses properly.

    • type : Optional [

      Must be one of: user, resource, task.

      ]
    • task_id : Optional [

      String

      ]

      In case :type = ‘task’, find the task by the uuid

    • user_id : Optional [

      String

      ]

      In case :type = ‘user’, find tasks for the user

    • resource_type : Optional [

      String

      ]

      In case :type = ‘resource’, what resource type we’re searching the tasks for

    • resource_type : Optional [

      String

      ]

      In case :type = ‘resource’, what resource id we’re searching the tasks for

    • action_types : Optional [

      Must be one of: String.

      ]

      Return just tasks of given action type, e.g. [Actions::Katello::Repository::Synchronize]

    • active_only : Optional [

      boolean

      ]
    • page : Optional [

      String

      ]
    • per_page : Optional [

      String

      ]

POST /foreman_tasks/api/tasks/bulk_resume

Params

  • host_id : Required [

    String

    ]

  • interface : Required [

    Hash

    ]

    informació de la interfície

    • mac : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      ]

    • ip : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      String

      ]

      Adreça IP de la interfície

    • type : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Must be one of: interface, bmc, bond, bridge.

      ]

      Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

    • name : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      String

      ]

      Nom DNS de la interfície

    • subnet_id : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Fixnum

      ]

      Foreman subnet ID of interface

    • domain_id : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Fixnum

      ]

      Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

    • identifier : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      String

      ]

      L’identificador de dispositiu, p. ex. eth0 o eth1.1

    • managed : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      boolean

      ]

      Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

    • primary : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      boolean

      ]

      Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

    • provision : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      boolean

      ]

      Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

      ]

      String

      ]

      Només per a les interfícies BMC.

    • provider : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      ]

    • virtual : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

    • mode : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Must be one of: balance-rr, active-backup, balance-xor, broadcast, 802.3ad, balance-tlb, balance-alb.

      Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

    • attached_devices : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Must be an array of any type

      ]

      Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.

    • bond_options : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      String

      ]

      Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

    • compute_attributes : Optional , <span class="translation_missing" title="translation missing: ca.apipie.nil_allowed">Nil Allowed</span> [

      Hash

      ]

      Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

Lifecycle environments

Description

An environment is a basic organization structure that groups systems, products, repositories, etc. Every system belongs to one environment and it’s isolated inside so that it can see only content that is in its environment.

Chains

Environments are ordered into chains and their content (propducts, repositories, tempaltes, packages) can be moved to an environment only from its prior environment. You can have for example chain like:

Library -> Development -> Testing -> Production

Each change in an environment is done through a changeset in an action called promotion.

Library

Library is a special environment that has no ascendant: All the content starts in this environment. More chains can start from the library environment but no further branching of a chain is enabled.

Lifecycle environments / index

GET /katello/api/environments
List environments in an organization

GET /katello/api/organizations/:organization_id/environments
List environments in an organization

Params

    Must be one of: true, false.

    set true if you want to see only library environments

      String

      ]

      The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

      for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

      Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

  • order : Optional [

    ]

    Hash

    ]

      boolean

      ]

      Whether the smart class parameter value is managed by Foreman

    • description : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Descripció de la classe intel·ligent

    • default_value : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Value to use when there is no match

    • hidden_value : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      When enabled the parameter is hidden in the UI

    • use_puppet_default : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      Do not send this parameter via the ENC. Puppet will use the value defined in the Puppet manifest for this parameter

    • path : Optional [

      String

      ]

      The order in which values are resolved

    • validator_type : Optional [

      Must be one of: regexp, list.

      ]

      Tipus de valors de validació

    • validator_rule : Optional [

      String

      ]

      Used to enforce certain values for the parameter values

    • override_value_order : Optional [

      String

      ]

      The order in which values are resolved

    • parameter_type : Optional [

      Must be one of: string, boolean, integer, real, array, hash, yaml, json.

      ]

      Tipus de valors de la variable

    • required : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      En cas que sigui cert, es produirà un error si no hi ha cap valor per defecte i no hi ha cap classificador que proporcioni un valor

    • merge_overrides : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      Merge all matching values (only array/hash type)

    • merge_default : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      Include default value when merging all matching values

    • avoid_duplicates : Optional [

      boolean

      ]

      Remove duplicate values (only array type)

PUT /api/environments/:environment_id/template_combinations/:id

    string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, ‘‘, ‘-’ with no leading or trailing space..

    Id. de la plantilla de configuració

    String

    String

    ]

    Id. del grup d’amfitrions

    String

    ]

    id. de l’entorn
